channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was brought to the HWPA in a lined tote for processing. No other information was provided. DescribePack: The caps were loose or completely off of all four bottles in the shipment. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a lined tote. PPE was worn while handling and inspecting the carton.

PPE was worn while handling and processing the damaged package.

item.title: Report E-2024030194
item.description:
Report E-2024030194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 5, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was cracked during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and sodium bicarbonate to remediate the UN2922-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030511
item.description:
Report X-2024030511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a leakage and the bottom soaked and placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Upon recognizing the antifreeze / coolant, the tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: Two of the bottles were dent in but only one of them had a loosened cap which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024030365
item.description:
Report X-2024030365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030365 SequenceEvent: Package was found covered in orange paint and with a leakage. It was placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the cans had a puncture like damage at the bottom of the can which resulted in a leakage. There were smaller boxes with the Ltd Qty symbol inside but nothing declared the outside of the box. All other cans were soiled in the orange paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. 2. X-2024030503 SequenceEvent: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage and then was transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the cans had a puncture like damage at the bottom of the box which was likely from added pressure and resulted in a leakage. There was a smaller box inside with the Ltd Qty symbol on it, as well ass airbags to fill in space. The rest of the cans were soiled in the paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report E-2024020449
item.description:
Report E-2024020449

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/20/24, at 1316 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered TILX270130, a loaded tank car of Hexamethylenediamine, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and shipper, Ascend Performance Materials, were notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-02-20-00151). Marion Environmental Inc., a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found 4 of the 4 liquid valve mounting flange bolts were less than tool tight. MEI personnel tightened the flange bolts to secure the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Tara Gardner, tgardn@ascendmaterials.com, 256-552-2528). The car was held at Radnor pending further repair and qualification by certified repair unit.

item.title: Report X-2024021623
item.description:
Report X-2024021623

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained sixteen glass bottles. they were packaged inside of plastic bags and had fiberboard dividers. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024030229
item.description:
Report E-2024030229

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 2-qt release of UN1263 "Spectracron comp white primer" released from (1) 55-gallon DM impacting the trailer floor, the drum had a structural failure. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable cleaning the release with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 85-gallon DM containing (1) 55-gallon DM of wasted product and (1) 5-gallon DF of Impacted oil dri were containerized and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN TRAILER WAS OPENED THE PACKAGE FELL ONTO THE FLOOR. PACKAGE WAS LOADED ONTOP OF OTHER PACKAGES. SEEING THAT IT WAS CORROSIVE THE MANAGER SENT OVER TO QA FOR INSPECTIONS. QA PROMPTY PUT INTO A BAG AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: AFTER INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND ALL FOR CAPS WERE LOOSE. ONLY 1 SAFETY FOIL WAS RUPTURED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM

item.title: Report X-2024030161
item.description:
Report X-2024030161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030161: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found with Class 8 label, fully regulated markings and paperwork in lined red tote on HMPA staging pallet. Ftrack shows OVH scan at NASH on 2/24/24, 16:14. Spidr shows potential damage as early as 2/24, 15:08. NO UNPOP RATING FOUND ON INNER CONTAINERS DESPITE "OVERPACK" LABEL FOUND ON OUTER PACKAGING. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN ELOU. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.7 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure, inadequate preparation for transport, and potential mishandling (see above). It should be noted every safety seal was attached to the underside of the cap closure and had no hold on the mouth of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. X-2024030162: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found with Class 8 label, fully regulated markings and paperwork in lined red tote on HMPA staging pallet. Ftrack shows OVH scan at NASH on 2/24/24, 18:25. Spidr shows potential damage as early as 2/24, 17:23. NO UNPOP RATING FOUND ON INNER CONTAINERS DESPITE "OVERPACK" LABEL FOUND ON OUTER PACKAGING. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN ELOU. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.2 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure, inadequate preparation for transport, and potential mishandling (see above). It should be noted every safety seal was attached to the underside of the cap closure and had no hold on the mouth of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used. X-2024030163: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found with Class 8 label, fully regulated markings and paperwork in lined red tote on HMPA staging pallet. NO UNPOP RATING FOUND ON INNER CONTAINERS DESPITE "OVERPACK" LABEL FOUND ON OUTER PACKAGING. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN ELOU. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.1 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure and inadequate preparation for transport. It should be noted every safety seal was attached to the underside of the cap closure and had no hold on the mouth of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024030165
item.description:
Report X-2024030165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Class 8 diamond label, fully regulated markings and paperwork found in lined red tote on HMPA staging pallet. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.8 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of the safety seal below the cap closure. All four safety seals on bottles were impacted; all were attached to the underside of the cap closure as opposed to the mouth of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report E-2024030153
item.description:
Report E-2024030153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of less than 10 pounds of "Provox C" onto the trailer floor when (1) 55lb paper bag of the product was discovered damaged due to poor loading at NDE. The SDS for the product was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that the terminal personnel could safely clean the spill with the PPE available so long as much caution was taken to avoid dust formation. The waste will be contained in a 55-gallon DF and left in the waste area for the terminal to manage.
